column4: hey guys, I'm on a laptop with an ATI card, but Xorg isn't loading, after the bootscreen it just flickers a couple of times and then stays blank..
during boot can you access the grub menu and try safe mode
then try
I can access it but only with 2.6.35-28-generic
strange though.. my mouse doesn't work in safe mode..
it gives me perl: warning: Setting locale failed.
yes, but it probably did a reconfigure of the X server anyways
try to reboot
still the same :s
radeon or nvidia or something completely different
I use nvidia, but it seems a lot of ppl have had problems with fglrx and radeon lately
not only with radeon.. nvidia as well.. it's something in the kernel..
how can you retain the old kernel versions if you have done a reinstall ?
in any case you should use the kernel version tested with your current distro release - if not all kinds of things might stop working
yes.. but it has to work then :p
ok its an upgrade you ran :-)
no.. euhm.. I had 10.10 but updated in april to 11.04. yesterday my theme went haywire and nautilus kept crashing, after reboot I still had the ugly theme in the login window but I couldn't log in..
from 11.04 to 11.04 is that even possible?
try to update all your packages then
yeah, I didn't know it either, but it listed it :p
tried the update.. will  try full-upgrade
note that was using aptitude
I am pretty sure the oss version works, the closed source - that is another matter
